Hosting video calls: Another way to stay connected is by hosting video calls. You could set up a regular schedule for a video call with your friends and family, and use video conferencing tools like Zoom or Skype to connect with them. This way, you can see each other and have a more personal conversation.

Meeting in person: If possible, you could plan to meet with your friends and family in person. This could be a weekly or monthly get-together, where you can catch up on each other's lives and spend quality time together.

Using social media: Social media can be a great way to stay connected with your friends and family. You could use platforms like Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter to share updates about your life and stay in touch with your loved ones.

Joining a community: Joining a community or group can help you stay connected with like-minded individuals. You could join a local club or organization, or participate in online forums or groups related to your interests.

Volunteering: Volunteering can be a great way to meet new people and stay connected with your community. You could volunteer at a local charity or organization, and use this opportunity to meet new people and make new friends.
